ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Great class for learning about taking photos, lighting, and basics of editing!

I developed a more enhanced perception for photography. Specifically, how to utilize different forms of light in photography. I learned key skills about how to use a camera, photoshop editing, and capturing different angles and environments.
A lot about photoshop color balancing and light.
I learned valuable skills in printing, photoshop editing, lighting, as well as the process of photo making.
This course made me realize my passion and ability in photography to the point where i decided I wanted to double major in art:photo and poli sci rather than just major in poli sci
techniques in digital photography and skills in fine art photography
I learned how to apply the formal techniques of photography such as exposure and lighting as well as how to use those formal techniques to produce work that expresses conceptual ideas and messages.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: great group of people, able to learn well from each other as well as from the professor and TA, critiques are very helpful for shaping future works
Weaknesses: spotty wifi/cell signal in the basement of the Art School; the doors in the stairwell would also lock at night so working at night would become  a hassle
There are no weaknesses of this course. I loved everything about this course. Definitely my favorite class at Yale so far!

Strengths: Dannielle and our TA Jessica were gems. Also students in class made this a great semester. 

Weaknesses: The crits were a bit short which made it hard to recieve feedback.

While the course could benefit from even more time spent looking at and talking about photos, my favorite part was going into Haas to review Artist files, aperture foundation features, and having in class artists talks. You learn a-lot about the photographic process this way and gain much inspiration in building a voice.
This course was my favorite course I have ever taken.
Only strengths: amazing!!! taught me so much in how to improve my hand at a digital camera and my eye in noticing subjects and frames that make for interesting photos

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! Such an engaging professor and a well-suited class to both beginners and continuing photographers to learn from each other
Yes, yes, yes! If you have photography experience, or none at all, this course is amazing!
Yes!

Yes, I have already recommended this course to many of my friends. I think every student at Yale should experience a photography class. You gain a lot of valuable skills and think of things in new, visually interesting ways.
Yes!! Having MFA photo second years as TAs is so fruitful and its a great opportunity to learn from folks actively practicing the art!
absolutely, if you want to explore how you engage with and perceive the world around you this course is for you.
Absolutely if at all interested in photography photography
Yes, especially those who have been wanting to take a photography class at Yale!
